I was born in the misty morning of October 11th, 1887 in Glochester. 
My father - a struggling alcoholic - grinned at the prospect of having to feed yet another poor soul and immediately directed my mother to get rid of me. 
So she did, without even hesitating. 
 
All this is of course nonsense, but we have to generate an (auto)biography that is long enough to be scrollable. 
That's why you'll have to bear with my Mumbo-Jumbo a bit more. 
Yada-yada-yada ... "
